de.mslab.bicliquesearch

Class BicliqueFinderContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mslab.bicliquesearch.BicliqueFinderContext

  • public class BicliqueFinderContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the context information for the biclique search.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      RoundBasedBlockCipher cipher
      A reference to a cipher instance.
      DifferentialComparator comparator
      A comparator which compares two differentials each whether they share active non-linear components or not.

      A difference builder which generates forward and backward differences for biclique search.

      The potential starting round of the biclique.

      All forward and backward differentials will be tested during biclique search whether they are independent.

      A flag which will stop the search for biciques in the given round range, if one biclique was found.

      The potential ending round of the biclique.

    • Field Detail

      • cipher

        public RoundBasedBlockCipher cipher
        A reference to a cipher instance. Required.

      • differenceBuilder

        public DifferenceBuilder differenceBuilder
        A difference builder which generates forward and backward differences for biclique search. Required.

      • comparator

        public DifferentialComparator comparator
        A comparator which compares two differentials each whether they share active non-linear components or not. Required.

      • fromRound

        public int fromRound
        The potential starting round of the biclique. Required.

      • toRound

        public int toRound
        The potential ending round of the biclique. Required.

      • dimension

        public int dimension
        For nearly all ciphers testing all possible key differences would become impractical. Thus, we set the differences to those keys with only a maximum active bits, nibbles or bytes, as key differences with many active components are likely to deliver shorter independent bicliques. The optimal value differs due to the specific cipher under test, for example, a good value for the AES is 8. This is a required parameter.

      • numThreads

        public int numThreads
        The desired number of threads which will be used in the BicliqueFinder. Required.

      • stopAfterFoundFirstBiclique

        public boolean stopAfterFoundFirstBiclique
        A flag which will stop the search for biciques in the given round range, if one biclique was found.

      • logInterval

        public long logInterval
        All forward and backward differentials will be tested during biclique search whether they are independent. Thus, the number of tests is the product of the amount of forward and backward differentials. In case when a high number will be tested, the BicliqueFinder will log the progress of testing after each n backward differentials are processed. You can set this n here.
